sentence: I was to inform the neighbour on my left that a robber had been spotted the same evening near the house of the neighbour in front. I did not do it and the same day the thieves broke into this neighbours house.

label: sadness
sentence: My mother was unwell and went for many cancer tests. She spent time in hospital being opened and closed many times.

label: fear
sentence: On May 20th I got a summon to appear in court on May 28th 1985 on the subject of impregnanting a school girl. I really feared of standing in the court in a few days time after this notice. I was also embarrassed due to formal approach that was expected of me to the Principal.

label: shame
sentence: I was saying bad things about a man I had never seen. I was with a friend and did not know that she was related to this man. My friend did not tell me about it and I discovered this myself.

label: sadness
sentence: The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She was of my own age
column4: there were many of my own friends present
column5: as well as her family etc.

label: guilt
sentence: After confronting the person who stood me up
column4: I blew up and said all the wrong things.

label: guilt
sentence: When I cheated my father and told him that the school administration wanted K80 for the purchase of a mini-bus. Two months later the school authorities wrote back to my father for the money. I could not go back and ask him for the money again as he had already given it to me once.

label: joy
sentence: When I was admitted to the Bulgarian State Conservatoire.

label: fear
sentence: When I entered the dissecting room for the anatomy class and saw several dead bodies lying on the benches.

label: shame
sentence: I was in a bus with my school material when I fell and sat on the lap of another passenger.

label: joy
sentence: When I won a tennis match.

label: shame
sentence: A serious drug error while nursing that I knew I was responsible for (patient lived
column4: no complications fortunately).

label: sadness
sentence: Once my friend and I got into into a hot discussion on a very controversial topic. At one point of the argument I disagreed with her totally and I took what she was saying as an insult. So I couter-argued and unknowingly hurt her emotionally
column4: I felt very sad about this.

label: guilt
sentence: During my holidays I had a boyfriend who turned away from me outwardly. Therefore I danced with another man and raised certain hopes in him. After a while I had to explain to him the circumstances

label: disgust
sentence: When I first saw the state of a cafeteria in the grounds of the university. Due to students own lack of concern for the environment in which they eat and drink. Rubbish and spilled tea and coffee left everywhere.

label: disgust
sentence: When mum had beaten my young sister just because she had received a letter from a boyfriend.

label: shame
sentence: When I failed the ninth standard exam in school.

label: joy
sentence: A friend of mine that is abroad undertook recently an axam to enter on University in Dallas
column4: and was approved.

label: disgust
sentence: A series about Freud was shown on TV. In it
column4: a tampon had been set in the nose of a woman
column5: and forgotten there. After great pain it was taken off (close-up picture)
column6: the woman was bleeding from the nose and the mouth.

label: fear
sentence: Staying alone in the dark.

label: disgust
sentence: A rich man expressing disgust towards an alcoholic.

label: shame
sentence: Not being able to argue against class leaders.

label: joy
sentence: When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever cared for me. This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed to learn that it was me who was delaying things.

label: anger
sentence: Falling in love although she is my friend (angry with myself).

label: anger
sentence: When being made look a fool by the teacher in front of the class during a turn.

label: disgust
sentence: When I was a child I broke plates because I wasn't given food on the grounds of coming home late.

label: joy
sentence: Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special occasions as Christmas etc. It really gives me joy to see my family and relatives and to observe natures productivity process which have been going on for centuries.

label: disgust
sentence: When a beggar approached me for money
column4: I felt disgusted.

label: shame
sentence: When a certain drunk man slapped my buttocks when I was quietly standing waiting for a bus.

label: sadness
sentence: The time I lost a badminton match
column4: that I should have won at the Zambia closed badminton championships.

label: fear
sentence: Whenever I think of enrolling in Organic Chemistry.

label: anger
sentence: When my mother told things to my sister
column4: which I told my mother in confidence

label: guilt
sentence: When I decided to move away from my parent's home
column4: my mother told me that it was as if a part of her had been torn out of her.

label: fear
sentence: When I got lost in New York city a late friday night with a friend of mine.

label: joy
sentence: The day I was happiest was the day when I received a phone call from Eve's Weekly to inform me that I had won the first prize of the All India Essay competition. I had won this prize when I was an under-graduate when even post graduates had participated. I had been judged by eminent judges and political scientists.

label: guilt
sentence: Squeezed the puppy in the door.

label: anger
sentence: I get angry with my brothers and sisters when they do something that I do not like. They know this and still do it so as to tease me.

label: anger
sentence: At work
column4: when an elderly man complained unjustifiably about me and distrusted me.

label: fear
sentence: I was visiting my parents in law when the house was invaded by three strange men
column4: and they committed an armed assault.

label: fear
sentence: I got lost in a foreign town. I did not know the language of that country and it took me hours to meet my friends again.

label: shame
sentence: Insulted my girlfriend during a peptalk.

label: joy
sentence: Hear my name on the list attending the English lectures.

label: anger
sentence: I was subject to false accusations
column4: and got very angry.

label: sadness
sentence: So as to be closer to the university I have left home and moved into Auckland. It now seems as if I have left home - especially my family - forever.

label: guilt
sentence: At a party
column4: I started talking to a guy I had seen in one of my classes. My boyfriend felt awkward and left to talk to a friend but kept on looking at me as I talked.

label: joy
sentence: I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that she had obtained a grant to work in the library.

label: shame
sentence: When I was 15 my mother discovered various items in my room which 15 year olds aren't usually expected to have - mainly alcohol
column4: marijuana and contraceptives !

label: shame
sentence: Every time I do not write something well in English.

label: disgust
sentence: When I made love with someone who I didn't really love. Sometimes I even considered him unlikable.

label: shame
sentence: My boyfriend's mother
column4: whom I had not met earlier
column5: made an unexpected visit. I was lying lazily on the bed
column6: reading a newspaper and my boyfriend was studying.

label: anger
sentence: In a very important basket-ball match where a lot was at stake
column4: I played very badly.

label: disgust
sentence: I had experienced odd moments one time when a patient came into the Ward in which I was working. The patient was badly burnt in the right side of her body. I was very nervous at the sight.

label: shame
sentence: Equivocal situation when filling a security questionnaire on entering a government building with several people there.

label: sadness
sentence: The passing away of my mum.

label: joy
sentence: [ I feel a sense of joy whenever I complete a piece of writing which is part of my work. Intense reading also brings me joy. I also feel happy when I reminiscent about them.]

label: guilt
sentence: I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring to find out and I had to tell her I had lied.

label: fear
sentence: When I saw a ghost.

label: guilt
sentence: Some boys told me your nickname is \Little Girl Doctor\
column4: I did not tell them off and laughed with them.

label: fear
sentence: When I was coming back home alone at night.

label: shame
sentence: I am ashamed when I am not prepared in a subject and I have to answer in the presence of the patients.

label: joy
sentence: When I was offered a high position of trust
column4: which I later accepted.

label: sadness
sentence: When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I had failed.

label: sadness
sentence: When I had stayed abroad for a long time and I had remembered about my friends and relatives. I felt sad and I wanted to see them as soon as possible.

label: sadness
sentence: My younger brother and sister were involved in an accident on their way back from school and my brother was quite badly hurt.

label: shame
sentence: When I promised to help a friend over a weekend and did not keep the promise.

label: shame
sentence: My sister said I am not a stable person
column4: and I think she is right.

label: sadness
sentence: Losing a pet chick. Our family had just put the chick outside a few days before and then one morning it was gone.

label: fear
sentence: We were riding in a friend's car. He was driving very fast and suddenly a another car crossed the road in front of us. My friend had to turn the car rapidly.

label: sadness
sentence: When I heard that my Uncle had passed away in a road traffic accident.

label: disgust
sentence: Class leader told me to collect homework for him.

label: joy
sentence: My boy-friend told me that he would take me to the training of the life-saving dogs.

label: joy
sentence: I had a very close friend who went to Canada after her F.B
column4: his departure was unavoidable. When he came back during the Summer holidays I was very happy as nothing had changed between us.

label: fear
sentence: I was spending my summer holidays in a village. My friend and I were coming back from a discotheque at night and we heard a noise from an alley. We were very scared and we got into my friend's house. A moment later
column4: an unknown car picked up a person from this alley.

label: disgust
sentence: When I heard that a woman of my community had aborted and got rid of the fetus by throwing it in the drain.

label: sadness
sentence: A good friend of mine died. During the funeral I felt an intense feeling of sadness.

label: disgust
sentence: The murder of two girls on a school trip to Berlin (and sexual crimes generally) a couple of years ago.

label: guilt
sentence: Wrongly accused a classmate.

label: fear
sentence: When I was in the army
column4: a room mate of mine came back from furlough and threatened another fellow with a knife.

label: shame
sentence: I didn't tell my parents that I was going to Sofia. I told them that I was going to a seminar. My mother knew that I was lying but she didn't stop me.

label: sadness
sentence: When I heard that my father had passed away.

label: sadness
sentence: A dear friend was removed from the division were I work.

label: disgust
sentence: A person I know who tells lies and so pretending to be better than she is.

label: guilt
sentence: When I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activity better but I had not done it because of reluctance or carelessness.
